SENT.plain: A 59-year-old woman with BehÃ§et's disease was admitted because of hemoptysis
She had undergone resection and patch closure of a thoracic descending aortic aneurysm 6 years before this current admission
The aortography after the first operation had shown a pseudoaneurysm at the operative site
In the current operation, we performed thromboexclusion with a temporary occlusion balloon in the distal thoracic descending aorta above Adamkiewicz
The post operative course was uneventful
Postoperative angiography demonstrated exclusion of the pseudoaneurysm and the patient was discharged without recurrent hemoptysis
